html: As Jehovah “foresaw” and “planned” from the beginning, the destruction of the wicked would precede the earth’s transformation to a paradisiacal state (Isaiah 33:1-20; 37:26). Although an end-time Assyria—of whom ancient Assyria is a type—would carry out that destruction, Assyria itself would be destroyed “in my own land” and “on my mountains.” Only remnants of the Ten Tribes who went captive into ancient Assyria would be left (Isaiah 19:23-25). By invading the lands of Jehovah’s people, Assyria would seal its own fate, and its yoke—the archtyrant—would be broken (Isaiah 9:4; 10:27).
